content: The "Raise the Wage Act" may be cited as the short title. Minimum wage increases are outlined in the Act. The Fair Labor Standards Act is amended to increase the base minimum wage for newly hired employees under 20 years old to $5.00 an hour for the first year, with subsequent yearly increases until it equals the wage in effect for that period. SEC. 5 of the Fair Labor Standards Act requires the Secretary to publish a notice 60 days before any increase in the required wage. SEC. 6 focuses on promoting economic self-sufficiency for individuals with disabilities. Information may also be given to individuals employed at a special minimum wage rate, including referrals to other entities for competitive integrated employment. The amendments made by this subsection regarding competitive integrated employment under the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 will take effect upon enactment of the Act.
